abstract.text: Encapsulated measurements of the attitude, rotation rate, and acceleration of a device.

inlineContent.text: objects at regular intervals after calling the

The accelerometer measures the sum of two acceleration vectors: gravity and user acceleration. User acceleration is the acceleration that the user imparts to the device. Because Core Motion is able to track a device’s attitude using both the gyroscope and the accelerometer, it can differentiate between gravity and user acceleration. A
object provides both measurements in the

abstract.text: Process accelerometer, gyroscope, pedometer, and environment-related events.
The device’s orientation relative to a known frame of reference at a point in time.
Constants that indicate the frame of reference for attitude-related motion data.
Calibrated magnetic field data and an estimate of the accuracy of the calibration.
Encapsulated measurements of the attitude, rotation rate, and acceleration of a device.
Defines the device’s sensor locations.
The attitude of the device.
The gravity acceleration vector expressed in the device’s reference frame.
The heading angle (measured in degrees) relative to the current reference frame.
Returns the magnetic field vector with respect to the device.
The rotation rate of the device.
The location of the sensors that compute the device-motion data.
The acceleration that the user is giving to the device.
An object that starts and manages headphone motion services.
The base class for all motion-related data objects.
Indicates the calibration accuracy of a magnetic field estimate
The object for starting and managing motion services.
Starts device-motion updates without a block handler.
Starts device-motion updates on an operation queue and using a specified block handler.
Starts device-motion updates using a reference frame but without a block handler.
Starts device-motion updates on an operation queue and using a specified reference frame and block handler.
Retrieve motion data that the system processed to remove environmental bias, such as the effects of gravity.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
